intro: Vernonanthura patens, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its tall, grass-like leaves and showy, pink or white flowers. The plant is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its fibrous leaves have been historically used by Māori for making clothing and baskets. Vernonanthura patens plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
